name: BREAK
description: Suspend execution or exit a block

name: CLOSE
description: Release an I/O device

name: DO
description: Execute a program, section of code or block

name: ELSE
description: Conditional execution based on $test

name: FOR
description: Iterative execution of a line or block

name: GOTO
description: Transfer of control to a label or program

name: HALT
description: Terminate execution

name: HANG
description: Delay execution for a specified period of time

name: IF
description: Conditional execution of remainder of line

name: JOB
description: Start an independent process

name: LOCK
description: Exclusive access/release named resource

name: KILL
description: Delete a local or global variable

name: MERGE
description: Copy arrays

name: NEW
description: Create new copies of local variables

name: OPEN
description: Obtain ownership of a device

name: QUIT
description: End a for loop or exit a block

name: READ
description: Read from a device

name: SET
description: Assign a value to a global or local variable

name: TCOMMIT
description: Commit a transaction

name: TRESTART
description: Roll back / restart a transaction

name: TROLLBACK
description: Roll back a transaction

name: TSTART
description: Begin a transaction

name: USE
description: Select which device to read/write

name: VIEW
description: Implementation defined

name: WRITE
description: Write to device

name: XECUTE
description: Dynamically execute strings

name: ZALLOCATE
description: Reserves the specified name

name: ZBREAK
description: Sets or clears a routine breakpoint

name: ZCOMPILE
description: Compiles a routine

name: ZCONTINUE
description: Continues excutioen after a break

name: ZDEALLOCATE
description: Release the specified name

name: ZEDIT
description: Invokes editor for routine editing

name: ZGOTO
description: Moves to EntryRef on a given stacklevel

name: ZHALT
description: Stops program execution with a return code

name: ZHELP
description: Accessses M help library

name: ZKILL
description: Kills a data value but not the descendants

name: ZLINK
description: Compiles an links a routine to the current process

name: ZMESSAGE
description: Raises an exception specified by given code

name: ZPRINT
description: Displays source code lines

name: ZRUPDATE
description: Publishes the new versions of routines to subscribers

name: ZSHOW
description: Displays information about the current environment

name: ZSTEP
description: Controls routine execution

name: ZSYSTEM
description: Creates a child of the current process

name: ZTCOMMIT
description: Marks the end of a logical transaction

name: ZTRIGGER
description: Invokes specified Global Triggers

name: ZTSTART
description: Marks the beginning of a logical transaction

name: ZWITHDRAW
description: Kills a data value but not the descendants

name: ZWRITE
description: Displays a complete global or local variable

name: $DEVICE
description: Status of the current device

name: $ECODE
description: List of unresolved error codes

name: $ESTACK
description: Number of stack levels; NEWing $ESTACK resets it to 0

name: $ETRAP
description: Code to execute on error

name: $HOROLOG
description: Days,seconds time stamp

name: $IO
description: Current IO unit

name: $JOB
description: Current process ID

name: $KEY
description: String that terminated the most recent READ command

name: $PRINCIPAL
description: Principal I/O device

name: $QUIT
description: Whether the current block of code was called as an extrinsic function (e.g. via $$)

name: $STACK
description: Current process stack level

name: $STORAGE
description: Amount of memory available, in bytes

name: $SYSTEM
description: System ID

name: $TEST
description: Result of prior IF command or READ/OPEN/LOCK command if invoked with a timeout

name: $TLEVEL
description: Number transactions in process

name: $TRESTART
description: Number of restarts on current transaction

name: $X
description: Position of horizontal cursor in current I/O device

name: $Y
description: Position of vertical cursor in current I/O device

name: $ASCII
description: ASCII numeric code of a character

parameters.name: VALUE
parameters.description: A string to get a code from

parameters.name: POS
parameters.description: The 1-based position of the character in VALUE; defaults to 1

name: $CHAR
description: ASCII character from numeric code

parameters.name: CODE
parameters.description: Numeric code to convert to a character
Additional codes to convert to characters

name: $DATA
description: Returns data about a variable: 0: if undefined, 1: if valued but has no descendants, 10: if has descendants but no value; 11: if has both a value and descendants

parameters.name: VAR
parameters.description: The variable to get data about, e.g. ^X

name: $EXTRACT
description: Extract a substring

parameters.name: VALUE
parameters.description: The string to get a substring from

parameters.name: START
parameters.description: The 1-based start index; defaults to 1

parameters.name: END
parameters.description: The 1-based end index; defaults to 2

name: $FIND
description: Find the 1-based index after the end of a substring or 0 if not found

parameters.name: WITHIN
parameters.description: The string to search in

parameters.name: SUBSTRING
parameters.description: The substring to search for

parameters.name: START
parameters.description: The 1-based index to start searching from; defaults to 1

name: $FNUMBER
description: Format a number

parameters.name: NUMBER
parameters.description: The number to format

parameters.name: FORMAT
parameters.description: One or more of the following: +: forces "+" on positive numbers; -: omits the "-" on negative numbers; ,: comma-separates the number by thousands; T: puts the sign in the trailing position; P: wraps negative numbers in parentheses and wraps positive numbers in spaces and may only be combined with comma (,)

parameters.name: DIGITS
parameters.description: The numer of digits after the decimal point

name: $GET
description: Get default or actual value

parameters.name: VAR
parameters.description: The variable to query, e.g. ^X(THIS,THAT)

parameters.name: DEFAULT
parameters.description: A value to use if VAR has no value; defaults to ""

name: $JUSTIFY
description: Right-justify a number or string by prefixing with spaces

parameters.name: VALUE
parameters.description: The string to justify

parameters.name: MINLENGTH
parameters.description: The minimum length of the result

parameters.name: DIGITS
parameters.description: The number of digits after the decimal point; providing this argument makes $JUSTIFY treat VALUE as a number

name: $LENGTH
description: Determine string length

parameters.name: VALUE
parameters.description: The string

parameters.name: SUBSTRING
parameters.description: If present, $LENGTH returns one more than the number of occurences of SUBSTRING in VALUE

name: $NAME
description: Evaluate and describe a variable

parameters.name: VAR
parameters.description: The variable to evaluate, including naked references

parameters.name: MAXSUBSCRIPT
parameters.description: The maximum number of subscripts to evaluate if VAR is an array

name: $ORDER
description: Find the subscript of the next or previous node

parameters.name: VAR
parameters.description: The array to query, e.g. ^AR

parameters.name: DIRECTION
parameters.description: 1: forward, -1: reverse; defaults to 1

name: $PIECE
description: Extract substring based on pattern

parameters.name: VALUE
parameters.description: The string

parameters.name: SUBSTRING
parameters.description: A delimiting string within VALUE

parameters.name: PIECE
parameters.description: Which 1-based piece of the split string to return; defaults to 1

parameters.name: LASTPIECE
parameters.description: The 1-based index of the last piece of the split string to return; defaults to PIECE

name: $QLENGTH
description: Number of subscripts in an array reference

parameters.name: VAR
parameters.description: The array to query, e.g. ^AR

name: $QSUBSCRIPT
description: Value of specified subscript

parameters.name: VAR
parameters.description: The array to query, e.g. ^AR

parameters.name: SUBSCRIPT
parameters.description: The 1-based index of the subscript to find; special values include -1: environment and 0: unsubscripted name

name: $QUERY
description: Next item in an array; invoke multiple times to iterate the entire array

parameters.name: VAR
parameters.description: The array to query, e.g. ^AR

name: $RANDOM
description: Random number

parameters.name: LIMIT
parameters.description: The generated random number will be between 0 (inclusive) and this LIMIT (exclusive)

name: $REVERSE
description: String in reverse order

parameters.name: VALUE
parameters.description: A string to reverse

name: $SELECT
description: Value of first true argument

parameters.name: TVEXPR
parameters.description: An expression to test for truth, followed by a colon and a value, e.g. i=42:"Answered!"
Additional truth value expressions to test; the last expression often starts with 1: to avoid errors

name: $STACK
description: Returns information about the process stack

parameters.name: LEVEL
parameters.description: -1: returns the highest stack level; 0: returns information about how the program was started; 1 to $STACK(-1): returns information about how the stack level was created

parameters.name: FIELD
parameters.description: "MCODE": the line of code that was executed; "PLACE": location of the executed code; "ECODE": the error code(s) added at the stack level, if any

name: $TEXT
description: Returns the text of a line of M[UMPS] code

parameters.name: REFERENCE
parameters.description: A reference to a code location, e.g. 'LABEL' or '+4^PROGRAM' or 'LABEL^PROGRAM', etc.

name: $TRANSLATE
description: Translate characters in a string

parameters.name: VALUE
parameters.description: The value to translate

parameters.name: OLD
parameters.description: Characters in VALUE to replace

parameters.name: NEW
parameters.description: Characters to replace OLD characters with; if not provided then OLD characters will be removed

name: $VIEW
description: Implementation defined

name: $ZAHANDLE
description: Returns unique identifier for a name or an alias container

parameters.name: VAR
parameters.description: The variable to find the handle for e.g

name: $ZASCII
description: ASCII numeric code of a 8-bit character

parameters.name: VALUE
parameters.description: A string to get a code from

parameters.name: POS
parameters.description: The 1-based position of the byte in VALUE; defaults to 1

name: $ZATRANSFORM
description: Returns the transformed representation of the first argument expr in a normalized form using the alternative transform specified by the second argument intexpr; the return can be used as an operand to the follows (]) or sorts-after (]]) operator such that, if both operands are in the normalized form, the result is independent of alternative collation.

parameters.name: VALUE
parameters.description: String to transform

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: ID of the alternative transform to use

parameters.name: NORMALIZE
parameters.description: whether the transform is to normalized form, by default or if zero (0), or, if one (1), the reverse transform from the normalized to the native form

parameters.name: MCOLLATION
parameters.description: whether to use standard M collation of numbers before strings, the default or zero (0), or to sort all values as strings (1)

name: $ZBITAND
description: Performs a logical AND function on two bit strings and returns a bit string equal in length to the shorter of the two arguments (containing set bits in those positions where both of the input strings have set bits). Positions corresponding to positions where either of the input strings have a cleared bit, also have cleared bits in the resulting string

parameters.name: FIRSTEXPR
parameters.description: first expression

parameters.name: 2NDEXPR
parameters.description: second expression

name: $ZBITCOUNT
description: Returns the number of ON bits in a bit string.

parameters.name: EXPR
parameters.description: The expression specifies the bit string to examine

name: $ZBITFIND
description: Performs the analog of $FIND() on a bit string. It returns an integer that identifies the position after the first position equal to a truth-valued expression that occurs at, or after, the specified starting position

parameters.name: VALUE
parameters.description: The expression specifies the bit string to examine

parameters.name: TRUTHVALUE
parameters.description: The truth-valued expression specifies the bit value for which $ZBITFIND() searches (1 or 0)

parameters.name: POS
parameters.description: The optional integer argument specifies the starting position at which to begin the search

parameters.name: VALUE
parameters.description: The expression specifies the bit string to examine

parameters.name: POS
parameters.description: The integer argument specifies the position in the string for which the value is requested

name: $ZBITLEN
description: Returns the length of a bit string, in bits

parameters.name: VALUE
parameters.description: The expression specifies the bit string to examine

name: $ZBITNOT
description: Returns a copy of the bit string with each input bit position inverted

parameters.name: VALUE
parameters.description: The expression specifies the bit string to invert

name: $ZBITOR
description: Performs a bitwise logical OR on two bit strings, and returns a bit string equal in length to the longer of the two arguments (containing set bits in those positions where either or both of the input strings have set bits). Positions that correspond to positions where neither input string has a set bit have cleared bits in the resulting string

parameters.name: FIRSTEXPR
parameters.description: first expression

parameters.name: 2NDEXPR
parameters.description: second expression

name: $ZBITSET
description: Returns an edited copy of the input bit string with a specified bit set to the value of the truth-valued expression

parameters.name: VALUE
parameters.description: The expression specifies the input bit string

parameters.name: POS
parameters.description: The integer expression specifies the position of the bit to manipulate. Arguments that are negative, zero, or exceed the length of the bit string produce a run-time error. $ZBIT functions count the first bit as position one (1)

parameters.name: TRUTHVALUE
parameters.description: The truth-valued expression specifies the value to which to set the specified bit (0 or 1)

name: $ZBITSTR
description: Returns a bit string of a specified length with all bit positions initially set to either zero or one

parameters.name: LENGTH
parameters.description: The integer expression specifies the length of the bit string to return; arguments that exceed the maximum length of 253,952 produce a run-time error

parameters.name: TRUTHVALUE
parameters.description: The optional truth-valued expression specifies the value to which all bit positions should initially be set (0 or 1). If this argument is missing, the bits are set to zero

name: $ZBITXOR
description: Performs a bitwise exclusive OR on two bit strings, and returns a bit string equal in length to the shorter of the two arguments (containing set bits in those positions where either (but not both) of the input strings have set bits). Positions that correspond to positions where neither or both input strings have a set bit have cleared bits in the resulting string

parameters.name: FIRSTEXPR
parameters.description: first expression

parameters.name: 2NDEXPR
parameters.description: second expression

name: $ZCHAR
description: Returns a string composed of bytes represented by the integer octet values specified in its argument(s).

parameters.name: Integer
parameters.description: The integer expression(s) specify the numeric byte value of the byte(s) $ZCHAR() returns
Additional codes to convert to characters

name: $ZCOLLATE
description: Returns the transformed representation of the first argument glvn in a normalized form using the alternative transform specified by the second argument intexpr; the return can be used as an operand to the follows (]) or sorts-after (]]) operator such that, if both operands are in the normalized form, the result is independent of alternative collation.

parameters.name: var
parameters.description: The subscripted or unsubscripted global or local variable name specifies the key to transform

parameters.name: TransformId
parameters.description: Specifies the ID of the alternative transform to use

parameters.name: NormForm
parameters.description: Specifies whether the transform is to normalized form, by default or if zero (0), or, if one (1), the reverse transform from the normalized to the native form.

name: $ZCONVERT
description: Returns its first argument as a string or value converted to a different encoding or numeric base. The two argument form changes the encoding for case within the ASCII character set. The three argument form changes the encoding scheme or base. Supported bases are decimal 'DEC' and 'HEX', case insensitive).

parameters.name: expr1
parameters.description: string or value to convert. $ZCONVERT() generates a run-time error if for Unicode conversion if the string contains a code-point value that is not in the character set, or for base conversion if the value to be converted is out of range

parameters.name: expr2
parameters.description: Specifies a code that determines the form of the result.

parameters.name: expr3
parameters.description: Code that specifies the character set or base of the result

name: $ZDATA
description: Extends $DATA() to reflect the current alias state of the lvn or name argument to identify alias and alias container variables. It treats variables joined through pass-by-reference as well as TP RESTART variables within a transaction as alias variables. However, it does not distinguish nodes having alias containers among their descendants.

parameters.name: var
parameters.description: Returns data about a variable: 0: if undefined, 1: if valued but has no descendants, 10: if has descendants but no value; 11: if has both a value and descendants; 100; 101; 111

name: $ZDATE
description: Returns a date and/or time formatted as text based on an argument formatted in the manner of $HOROLOG

parameters.name: expr1
parameters.description: $HOROLOG format of the date and/or time

parameters.name: expr2
parameters.description: Pattern of desired output p.e. 'YEAR-MM-DD'

parameters.name: expr3
parameters.description: Specifies a list of 12 month codes, separated by commas (,)

parameters.name: expr4
parameters.description: Specifies a list of seven day codes, separated by commas (,)

name: $ZEXTRACT
description: Returns a byte sequence from a given sequence of octets (8-bit bytes).

parameters.name: expr1
parameters.description: Specifies a sequence of octets (8-bit bytes) from which $ZEXTRACT() derives a byte sequence

parameters.name: intexpr1
parameters.description: Specifies the starting byte position in the byte string

parameters.name: intexpr2
parameters.description: Specifies the ending byte position for the result

name: $ZFIND
description: Returns an integer byte position that locates the occurrence of a byte sequence within a sequence of octets(8-bit bytes).

parameters.name: expr1
parameters.description: Specifies the sequence of octets (8-bit bytes) in which $ZFIND() searches for the byte sequence

parameters.name: expr2
parameters.description: specifies the byte sequence for which $ZFIND() searches

parameters.name: expr3
parameters.description: Identifies the starting byte position for the $ZFIND() search

name: $ZGETJPI
description: Returns job or process information of the specified process

parameters.name: expr1
parameters.description: Identifies the PID of the target job. If expr1 is an empty string (“”), $ZGETJPI() returns information about the current process.

parameters.name: expr2
parameters.description: Specifies the item keyword identifying the type of information returned

name: $ZJOBEXAM
description: Returns the full specification of the file specified by the optional expr1 argument into which the function places a ZSHOW output specified by expr2

parameters.name: expr1
parameters.description: A template output device specification. It can be a device, a file directory, or a file name.

parameters.name: expr2
parameters.description: Defaulting to '*', expr2 specifies the ZSHOW Information Codes of data to be included in the output

parameters.name: expr1
parameters.description: The expression specifies the sequence of octets formatted by $ZJUSTIFY().

parameters.name: expr2
parameters.description: Specifies the minimum size of the resulting byte sequence.

parameters.name: expr3
parameters.description: The number of digits after the decimal point; providing this argument makes $ZJUSTIFY treat expr1 as a number

name: $ZLENGTH
description: Returns the length of a sequence of octets measured in bytes, or in “pieces” separated by a delimiter specified by one of its arguments

parameters.name: expr1
parameters.description: Specifies the sequence of octets that $ZLENGTH() “measures”.

parameters.name: expr2
parameters.description: specifies the delimiter that defines the measure; if this argument is missing, $ZLENGTH() returns the number of bytes in the sequence of octets.

name: $ZMESSAGE
description: Returns a message string associated with a specified status code .

parameters.name: expr1
parameters.description: The integer expression specifies the status code for which $ZMESSAGE() returns error message text .

name: $ZPARSE
description: Expands a file name to a full pathname and then returns the full pathname or one of its fields (directory, name, or extension).

parameters.name: expr1
parameters.description: Specifies the file name; if the file name is not valid, $ZPARSE() returns a null string

parameters.name: expr2
parameters.description: Specifies the field of the pathname that $ZPARSE() returns

parameters.name: expr3
parameters.description: Specify default values to use during file name expansion for missing fields (directory, name, or extension)

parameters.name: expr4
parameters.description: Specify default values to use during file name expansion for missing fields (directory, name, or extension)

parameters.name: expr5
parameters.description: Specifies the mode or type of parse that $ZPARSE() performs.

name: $ZPIECE
description: Return a sequence of bytes delimited by a specified byte sequence made up of one or more bytes.

parameters.name: expr1
parameters.description: specifies the sequence of octets from which $ZPIECE() takes its result.

parameters.name: expr2
parameters.description: Specifies the delimiting byte sequence that determines the piece 'boundaries'

parameters.name: expr3
parameters.description: Specifies the beginning piece to return

parameters.name: expr4
parameters.description: Specifies the last piece to return

name: $ZPREVIOUS
description: Returns the subscript of the previous local or global variable name in collation sequence within the array level specified by its argument.

parameters.name: glvn
parameters.description: Specifies the node prior to which $ZPREVIOUS() searches backwards for a defined node with data and/or descendants.

name: $ZQGBLMOD
description: Enables an application to determine whether it can safely apply a lost transaction to the database.

parameters.name: gvn
parameters.description: The subscripted or non-subscripted global variable name (gvn) specifies the target node.

name: $ZSEARCH
description: Attempts to locate a file matching the specified file name. If the file exists, it returns the file name; if the file does not exist, it returns the null string.

parameters.name: expr1
parameters.description: Contains a file name, with or without wildcards, for which $ZSEARCH() attempts to locate a matching file.

parameters.name: expr2
parameters.description: Specifies an integer expression that is a stream number. It can be any value from 0 to 255 for each search

name: $ZSIGPROC
description: Sends a signal to a process. The format for the $ZSIGPROC function is

parameters.name: expr1
parameters.description: The pid of the process to which the signal is to be sent.

parameters.name: expr2
parameters.description: The system signal name (e.g., 'SIGUSR1' or just 'USR1').

name: $ZSOCKET
description: Returns information about a SOCKET device and its attached sockets

parameters.name: expr1
parameters.description: Specifies the SOCKET device name

parameters.name: expr2
parameters.description: Specifies a keyword identifying the type of information returned

parameters.name: expr3
parameters.description: Specifies the index (starting at zero) of a socket attached to the device

parameters.name: expr4
parameters.description: Specifies an individual delimiter when the second expression specifies DELIMITER.
